channel.title: jimgrisham tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from jimgrisham.

item.description: @michaeljacobsa @leeferran Montana _is_ pretty darn awesome.
@DirkSchwenk @ChrisO_wiki @TrentTelenko They surely have their top men maintaining those. Top men.
@luke_dawgfan @ChrisO_wiki Too bad they couldn’t annex Afghanistan…

@cayley_s @spiantado There’s a desire to measure something, but in a large, complicated society, doing so is impracticable (even if theoretically solvable)? Perhaps there is nothing to measure universally? (Even the physical sciences contend with that.)

@schneierblog Again, though, not so much a ‘flaw’ with Bluetooth itself; it’s more of an indictment of the hubris of the auto & lock manufacturers. “Gouda flaw leads to failure of organic-based bank vault locks during periods of high ambient temperatures.”

@heathmcgough @TheRealJimSanto @AndrewDesiderio Unanimous among those present, that is. [I don’t believe the presence of individual Senators is recorded in these cases, so other than the Senator on camera calling the vote (and maybe a few others) it’s hard to pin down who voted and who was absent.]
@agraybee (Also, as he said afterwards, he’s 75 years old.)

@TheRealJimSanto @AndrewDesiderio It happens all the time, for both procedural motions and also for final confirmations. (Additionally, sometimes Senators just get too tired to argue and want to go home/fundraise.) Another benefit: with voice votes no one has to be on the record.

@smileyherring @MarkHertling Someone elsewhere stated it was some sort of NATO communications system? that wasn’t compatible with Ukrainian systems. They surely got whatever they needed (perhaps with the Canadian M777s) to utilize those advanced shells.
@JoHonterus @noclador https://t.co/AbcAs3YOCJ
@TheOriginalGVC @noclador Perhaps the risk of ripping the bags open if they were to snag on machinery?
@rottenporker @frtpkr680 @noclador https://t.co/AbcAs3YOCJ

@ophardy @igorsushko The bombers normally never leave Russian airspace. Some of the incoming missiles are being launched from from ships in the Caspian Sea, many hundreds of kilometers behind the border.

@Bradninchfellow @BretDevereaux Indeed: “a time” could easily be several _centuries_ or more (see: slaves of African descent), but no coercion can last forever. [I often wonder what the root causes of Chinese fear (other than centuries of pre-modern regional instability) is regarding those groups.]

@FriedrichFiles @ThomasCatt1812 @amandalhu Units called ‘Heat Recovery Ventilators’ and ‘Energy Recovery Ventilators’ are available that allow ventilation with negligible increases in energy usage by transferring heat (#HRV) or heat+humidity (#ERV) between the stale and fresh air.
